cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.systemGeoRefPt1: ABOUT 380 MI...615 KM SW OF MANZANILLO MEXICO
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP2 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Tropical Storm Greg Advisory Number 5 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP072017 900 AM MDT Tue Jul 18 2017
...GREG CONTINUES TO MOVE AWAY FROM LAND...
SUMMARY OF 900 AM MDT...1500 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...15.0N 108.3W ABOUT 380 MI...615 KM SW OF MANZANILLO MEXICO MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...40 MPH...65 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...WNW OR 290 DEGREES AT 9 MPH...15 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1007 MB...29.74 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 900 AM MDT (1500 UTC), the center of Tropical Storm Greg was located near latitude 15.0 North, longitude 108.3 West. Greg is moving toward the west-northwest near 9 mph (15 km/h. A mainly westward motion at a slightly faster forward speed is expected over the next 48 hours.
Maximum sustained winds are near 40 mph (65 km/h) with higher gusts. Some strengthening is forecast during the next 48 hours.
Tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 35 miles (55 km) from the center.
The estimated minimum central pressure is 1007 mb (29.74 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 300 PM MDT.
$$ Forecaster Pasch
NNNN
